articles.name: Running with errors / Database stopped
articles.title: Running with errors / Database stopped
articles.body:
You see the error message "eblocker is running with errors" or "database stopped" when starting your eBlocker, or when calling the eBlocker user interface?

In this very rare case, please try to restore the eBlockers factory settings to solve this problem.
Instructions for restoring the factory settings can be found here.

If your eBlocker still shows this error message, please create a small status report with the help of an USB 2.0 flash drive. Please send this file with a short description of your problem to our support team (support@eblocker.com).

How to write a short status report on a USB thumb (USB2.0 / FAT16 or FAT32 formated) drive?

  • Disconnect eBlocker from power, but let the Ethernet cable connected to the eBlocker
  • Insert a USB thumb drive (On the eBlocker in the transparent case, please use one of the USB ports on the longer side, not the ports next to the Ethernet port)
  • Power up the eBlocker
  • Wait for 3 minutes

After that you can pull out the USB drive and attach it to your computer. There should be a file "eblocker-status.html" on the drive. Please send this file to our support (support@eblocker.com).

articles.name: What is the Tor Network?
articles.title: What is the Tor Network?
articles.body: The Tor network is used to disguise your original IP address and to provide anonymous Internet surfing. Suppose you have a certain page you want to visit and therefore you enter the URL into the web browser. Your IP address is sent directly to the page you want to visit. However, if you use Tor, you will be directed into the Tor network, which is made out of many other IP addresses from different computers. The Tor network will send an IP address to the page that it chooses randomly out of all the other IP addresses floating around the Tor network. This is how your real IP address is disguised.

articles.name: Will the eBlocker source code be published / made available to the Open Source community for further development?
articles.title: Will the eBlocker source code be published / made available to the Open Source community for further development?
articles.body: The decision to publish is incumbent on the insolvency administrator and no decision has yet been taken.

articles.name: How is eBlockerOS tested?
articles.title: How is eBlockerOS tested?
articles.body:
We test the eBlockerOS with various current operating systems, such as Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, and Linux. We always concentrate our tests on the latest versions of the operating systems and on the versions of the operating systems which are still supported by the manufacturer.

During the operating system tests we always use a clean installation of the operating system, so that we can test the eBlockerOS functions in the best possible way.

Note: The more third-party software installed on the operating systems, the more likely it is that problems may occur. This is especially important for programs that change the network settings, or restore settings when the computer is started.

Generally the eBlocker also supports older operating systems - however it could lead to problems with the display of the eBlocker interface, or to problems with the eBlocekrs SSL / HTTPS function.

Also read our FAQ article for older operating systems... (Link)

Tip: For virtual operating systems, for example the VirtualBox program from Oracle, the network adapter for the virtual environment must be set to "Bridge Mode". Otherwise, the virtual operating system will get an IP address outside your IP address range.

Tip: If you are actively using antivirus software, please read our FAQ "My virus scanner complains about SSL connections". (Link)

We also test the eBlockerOS with different current browsers. These include Windows Edge, Internet Explorer, Safari, Firefox, Opera and Chrome / Chromium. In general eBlockerOS also works with all so-called clones of such browsers as Vivaldi (Chromium), Brave (Chromium), Yandex (Chromium) and Cliqz (Firefox).

The Google Chromium Browser is the open source version of the Google Chrome Browser.

The eBlockerOS is tested by us with a variety of current routers. These include current AVM Fritzbox routers, routers from Netgear, Asus and also TP-Link.

In general, eBlocker is compatible with almost all routers. If the eBlocker is not compatible with a router in its automatic network settings (Plug & Play), the network settings of each eBlocker can also be changed to the so-called individual settings. eBlocker can even be configured for networks without a DHCP server.

Read also our FAQ article about repeaters... (Link)

articles.name: Will the eBlocker support the IPv6 protocol?
articles.title: Will the eBlocker support the IPv6 protocol?
articles.body: We plan to support the IPv6 protocol, but its migration is more challenging for the eBlocker with its features.

articles.name: What is a VPN network?
articles.title: What is a VPN network?
articles.body: A virtual private network (VPN) extends a private network across a public network, and enables users to send and receive data across the public network as if their computing devices were directly connected to the private network.

articles.name: I have (just) bought an XYZ license. Can I return it?
articles.title: I have (just) bought an XYZ license. Can I return it?
articles.body: Unfortunately, update licenses are generally excluded from return.

articles.name: I have a new router, what do I have to do?
articles.title: I have a new router, what do I have to do?
articles.body:
Before installing the new router, please do the following:

  • For your old router, activate the DHCP server in the settings menu.
  • For eBlocker (Settings > Network) set the network mode to "automatic".

After saving these changes, your eBlocker restarts - this takes about five minutes.

Now you can exchange the old router for the new one. Then restart all devices (including the eBlocker) once or disconnect briefly from the network connection.

A hint from Support:

It is likely that your new router has different DHCP server settings than your old router. Therefore, delete all devices found in the eBlocker settings from the Devices menu and restart the search.

articles.name: eBlocker Meltdown & Spectre information!
articles.title: eBlocker Meltdown & Spectre information!
articles.body:
Is the eBlocker affected by the Meltdown & Spectre Security issue?

No, the eBlocker processors are based on a Cortex-A7 core and are not affected by the Meltdown & Spectre Security issue.¬†

Sources:¬†

https://developer.arm.com/support/security-update
http://linux-sunxi.org/H3
http://linux-sunxi.org/A31s

If you've build a DIY eBlocker based on a Raspberry Pi 2 or Pi 3, you don't have to worry as well.
The Raspberry Pi 2 and 3 use a Cortex-A7 and A53 core, which are not affected by the Meltdown & Spectre Security issue.

Sources:
https://developer.arm.com/support/security-update
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raspberry_Pi

articles.name: What do I do if my 1-year license (Pro/Family) has expired? Can I buy/receive a renewal?
articles.title: What do I do if my 1-year license (Pro/Family) has expired? Can I buy/receive a renewal?
articles.body: The sale has been completely discontinued and updates will be available until 30.06.2019.

articles.name: I have a new router and cannot reach the eBlocker anymore.
articles.title: I have a new router and cannot reach the eBlocker anymore.
articles.body:
If you replace the old router with a new router, you may not be able to reach the eBlocker even though the network LEDs on the eBlocker are lit or flashing.

One reason could be that your eBlocker's DHCP server is enabled. This collides with the also active DHCP server of your new router.

In this case we recommend resetting the eBlocker to its factory settings.
We have described here how this works.

articles.name: I want to sell my eBlocker.
articles.title: I want to sell my eBlocker.
articles.body:
If you want to resell the eBlocker, we recommend the following steps before shipping:

1. Restore the eBlocker's factory settings.

Please follow these steps:

  • Create an empty file named "eblocker-factory-reset.txt" on the USB stick.
  • Disconnect the eBlocker from the power supply.
  • Connect the USB stick to the lower USB port of the eBlocker.
  • Connect the eBlocker to the power supply.
  • The factory settings will now be restored. After approx. 5 minutes the eBlocker should turn off again (no LED activity).
  • Remove the USB stick.

2. Write us an email to support@eblocker.com:

We need the following information from you to reassign the license key in our license database:

  • The first three blocks of the license key.
  • The serial number of your eBlocker (located at the bottom of the eBlocker).
  • Your email address with which you activated the eBlocker license.
  • The email address of the new owner, so that they can activate the eBlocker with the license key.

We will contact you as soon as we have changed the license.

articles.name: Is there a "special termination right" for my update subscription? What happens if I cancel?
articles.title: Is there a "special termination right" for my update subscription? What happens if I cancel?
articles.body: You can cancel your subscription at any time before the end of the cancellation period. You will then only receive updates as long as your license is valid - but no later than 30.06.2019.

articles.name: I bought the eBlocker second hand.
articles.title: I bought the eBlocker second hand.
articles.body:
If the seller contacted you before the purchase, you should be able to set up your eBlocker normally.

If this is not the case, we need some information from you so that we can reassign the eBlocker license for you.

Write us an email to support@eblocker.com and tell us:

  • The first three blocks of the license key.
  • The serial number of your eBlocker (located at the bottom of the eBlocker).
  • The email address with which you want to activate your eBlocker license key.

We will contact you as soon as we have the license setup.

After that you should reset the eBlocker to its factory settings once.

Please follow these steps:

  • Create an empty file named "eblocker-factory-reset.txt" on the USB stick.
  • Disconnect the eBlocker from the power supply.
  • Connect the USB stick to the lower USB port of the eBlocker.
  • Connect the eBlocker to the power supply.
  • The factory settings are now restored. After approx. 5 minutes the eBlocker will switch off again (no LED activity).
  • Remove the USB stick.

Now connect your eBlocker to your router and connect the eBlocker to the power supply. Starting the eBlocker takes approximately 5 minutes.
Then go to the setup.eblocker.com page in a browser and click on the eBlocker icon at the top right of this page.
The Controlbar opens and you can run the Activation Wizard.

articles.name: What do I do if I want to switch from eBlocker Base or Pro to Pro or Family? Can I still buy/receive a license upgrade?
articles.title: What do I do if I want to switch from eBlocker Base or Pro to Pro or Family? Can I still buy/receive a license upgrade?
articles.body: The sale of update licenses is discontinued.

articles.name: Who can I contact if I have technical questions or have a warranty claim?
articles.title: Who can I contact if I have technical questions or have a warranty claim?
articles.body: You can contact our support at support@eBlocker.com until 14.06.2019.

articles.name: Can I use the eBlocker for other purposes?
articles.title: Can I use the eBlocker for other purposes?
articles.body: The eBlocker is based on a standard single board computer Banana PI M2+. With the appropriate technical knowledge you can use this mini-computer also for other purposes.

articles.name: Can I get root access to the eBlocker?
articles.title: Can I get root access to the eBlocker?
articles.body: No, there is no root password. The root account is locked.

articles.name: Will there still be a support forum?
articles.title: Will there still be a support forum?
articles.body: The Support Forum will run until 30.06.2019.

articles.name: Will the website continue to be operated?
articles.title: Will the website continue to be operated?
articles.body: After 30.06.2019 the eBlocker website will no longer be available.
